title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

You are going to be seeing this post from this obsessed woman's for a long time. You have the means to stop me posting.

As I write there are 91,064 signatures on the petition. That is an additional 101 signatures since this time yesterday. At this rate the date for hitting 100,000 signatures is Friday 12 May, 88 days away.

If anyone can think of any method of getting this message out to other people then please do so

The last we thing we want is the petition to remove LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

Please sign if you are a UK citizen and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 1,860 people that have boosted this message so far.
💖 ❤️ 💖 ❤️

Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631529

#TransRightsAreHumanrRghts #Trans

title: The Market for Lemons

last_post.content:
Notes from Alex Russell on JS frameworks and the false promise of how better developer experience was supposed to bring better UX: "Once the lemon sellers embed the data-light idea that improved "Developer Experience" leads to better user outcomes, improving "DX" became and end unto itself. Many who knew better felt forced to play along.
The long lead time for falsifying trickle-down UX was a feature, not a bug; they don't need you to succeed, only to keep buying."
https://infrequently.org/2023/02/the-market-for-lemons/

title: GitHub - quadrismegistus/mastotron: Different interface to mastodon

last_post.content:
Introducing my hobby coding project since xmas:

Mastotron!

It's a different interface to Mastodon, replacing the mindless "feed" of most social media with a network map of conversations and recent and popular posts.

👉 You can download it here: https://github.com/quadrismegistus/mastotron 🖖

There's easy, double-click installation for Mac and Linux; Windows is a bit trickier for now.

This is b new, so bound to be bugs. But if you can, give it a whirl, and let me know if it works and what you'd like to see!

title: https://mastodon.ngo

last_post.content:
#introduction

A few weeks ago there was a discussion about the need for a #Mastodon instance dedicated to NGOs, nonprofits, and folks in the human rights space.

So I got to work with @happy and @gillo and created https://mastodon.ngo! We're admin'ing this instance together and we'll be maintaining it for the long term.

If you or your organization or someone you know is interested in creating an account, let me know. You can also request an account here: https://mastodon.ngo/about

title: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2302.04222.pdf

last_post.content:
LOVE this. Via @meg
" In particular, models can learn to
mimic the artistic style of specific artists after “fine-tuning”
on samples of their art. In this paper, we describe the design,
implementation and evaluation of Glaze, a tool that enables
artists to apply “style cloaks” to their art before sharing on-
line. These cloaks apply barely perceptible perturbations to
images, and when used as training data, mislead generative
models that try to mimic a specific artist"
https://arxiv.org/pdf/2302.04222.pdf

title: GLAZE: Protecting Artists from Style Mimicry by Text-to-Image Models

last_post.content: New defensive upload-prefiltering tech for artists just dropped: https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.04222

title: Mastodon, Steampipe, and RSS

last_post.content:
The new TagExplore tab in the #Steampipe dashboard for Mastodon seems like a good way to find people based on their interests. It makes use of the tag enrichment strategy described in https://blog.jonudell.net/2022/12/06/mastodon-steampipe-and-rss/ to show tags that co-occur with the input tag. And of course relationship graphs as described in https://blog.jonudell.net/2023/01/16/mastodon-relationship-graphs/.

#Steampipe #Mastodon #Tagging #Discovery

This Quanta Magazine article is enormous fun, full of things I should have known but didn’t. I’d never heard of Choe’s hexagons before, and I’d never pondered the asymptotics of the surface of a unit-volume ball in n dimensions.

S_n → √(2 e π n)

last_post.content:
From my weekend:
"For what is journalism itself but lossy compression of the world?... For that matter, what is a library or a museum or a curriculum but lossy compression — that which fits? What is culture but lossy compression of creativity? As Umberto Eco said, “Now more than ever, we realize that culture is made up of what remains after everything else has been forgotten."

title: Fewer followers, more engagement: What I found in a Twitter-versus-Mastodon test

last_post.content:
Journalists like @dankennedy_nu are beginning to notice that Mastodon has more engagement than Twitter.

For me, this has been true for a long time. Engagement on Twitter is like winning the lottery. Whereas, on Mastodon, engagement is just a fact of life when using the service.

If the point of social media is to be *social*, the Mastodon beats the pants off of Twitter.

https://dankennedy.net/2023/02/12/fewer-followers-more-engagement-what-i-found-in-a-twitter-versus-mastodon-test/

title: Machine Learning: The High Interest Credit Card of Technical Debt – Google Research

last_post.content:
All the hype about souped up developer productivity using LLMs for coding reminds me of the original title of this 2014 paper, before it was milquetoasted in 2015 acceptance.

LLMs can help you rapidly acquire semi-plagiarized fragments of well-traveled code instead of using a quality library with vision of the problem domain. Might be great for KPIs, but this debt will come back to bite you, unless you're already gone. Will be painful for orgs to adapt.
https://research.google/pubs/pub43146/

Hi Mastodon! Really glad to be here. It feels good to have a people-driven federated platform to gather around and have some meaningful interactions about graphics and stuff. My name's Gleb, I'm a 3d artist, tutorial maker at Creative Shrimp. I'm a #belarusian, love open-source graphics, #photography and coffee (going for espresso usually). Вітанкі 🤍❤️🤍

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@GlebAlexandrov
Artstation: https://www.artstation.com/gleb_alexandrov

#art #MastoArt #mastodon #fediverse #twitter #exodus #b3d #3d #DigitalArt

title: Twitter exec says 'hundreds of thousands' of Russian disinformation accounts still active on Twitter

last_post.content:
I wrote about the most-overlooked part of Wednesday’s Oversight Committee hearing: The revelation that “thousands, maybe hundreds of thousands” of Russian disinformation accounts are still active on the platform, waging an ongoing war on reality.

This is the first we’ve heard of an ongoing foreign disinfo campaign of this magnitude, and the implications are staggering.
https://weaponizedspaces.substack.com/p/twitter-exec-says-hundreds-of-thousands

title: Now for sale: Data on your mental health

last_post.content:
As @emmalbriant has documented extensively, these mental health data brokers are not merely messing with people's personal privacy — they're helping the Cambridge Analyticas of the world target emotionally vulnerable people with agitprop and disinformation, contributing to events like #J6 and mass shootings.

(via @drewharwell @washingtonpost) https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/02/13/mental-health-data-brokers/

title: Doctors and Nurses Shouldn't Be Able to Report Your Pregnancy Loss to the Police

last_post.content:
There is a loophole in HIPAA that allows doctors and nurses to report a pregnancy loss to the police. I've lost count of the number of times I've seen people read stories like this and say, "Doesn't HIPAA prohibit that?" and I have to tell them, "Haha. Nope."

https://jezebel.com/does-hipaa-law-protect-information-about-abortion-1850108057

title: Runs Only Failing Tests

last_post.content:

title: Heckerthoughts

last_post.content:
"Heckerthoughts" — A manuscript going through the basic concepts central to AI and Machine Learning where the author claims that some concepts he included are missing from modern ML courses. Conversational style, anecdotal, and not too long at 54 pages. Worth reading …

Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.05449

#AI #NewPaper #DeepLearning #MachineLearning
